dt: {bc}something voluntarily transferred by one person to another without compensation
{bc}the act, right, or power of giving

pt: {sc}gift{/sc} {sc}faculty{/sc} {sc}aptitude{/sc} {sc}bent{/sc} {sc}talent{/sc} {sc}genius{/sc} {sc}knack{/sc} mean a special ability for doing something. {sc}gift{/sc} often implies special favor by God or nature.
{sc}faculty{/sc} applies to an innate or less often acquired ability for a particular accomplishment or function.
{sc}aptitude{/sc} implies a natural liking for some activity and the likelihood of success in it.
{sc}bent{/sc} is nearly equal to {sc}aptitude{/sc} but it stresses inclination perhaps more than specific ability.
{sc}talent{/sc} suggests a marked natural ability that needs to be developed.
{sc}knack{/sc} implies a comparatively minor but special ability making for ease and dexterity in performance.

et: Middle English, from Old Norse, something given, talent; akin to Old English {it}giefan{/it} to give
shortdef: a notable capacity, talent, or endowment
something voluntarily transferred by one person to another without compensation
the act, right, or power of giving

dt: {bc}to endow with some power, quality, or attribute

dt.t: She's been {wi}gifted{/wi} with a beautiful voice.
It makes an excellent choice whether you're {wi}gifting{/wi} one bottle for the honeymoon or a case to be savored for years, or even decades, to come.
In this, her ninth novel, she has succeeded in {wi}gifting{/wi} us with a story that will stay with us for a long time.

shortdef: to endow with some power, quality, or attribute

dt: gamete intrafallopian transfer; gamete intrafallopian tube transfer

shortdef: gamete intrafallopian transfer; gamete intrafallopian tube transfer

dt: {bc}a card entitling the recipient to receive goods or services of a specified value from the issuer

shortdef: a card entitling the recipient to receive goods or services of a specified value from the issuer

dt: {bc}a certificate entitling the recipient to receive goods or services of a specified value from the issuer

shortdef: a certificate entitling the recipient to receive goods or services of a specified value from the issuer

dt: {bc}a system in which goods and services are given freely between people rather than sold or bartered

dt.t: The {wi}gift economy{/wi}—a system whereby goods are not sold but given away—has been around for as long as we've had things.

shortdef: a system in which goods and services are given freely between people rather than sold or bartered

dt: {bc}the ability to talk glibly and persuasively

shortdef: the ability to talk glibly and persuasively

dt: {bc}a divinely granted gift or talent identified by ecstatic, usually unintelligible speech {dx}see also {dxt|tongue:1||4c}{/dx}

et: from the gifts of the Spirit in 1 Corinthians 12:1–13
shortdef: a divinely granted gift or talent identified by ecstatic, usually unintelligible speech

dt: {bc}to wrap (merchandise intended as a gift) decoratively

shortdef: to wrap (merchandise intended as a gift) decoratively

dt: {bc}a list kept by a store of the things that someone wants as gifts

shortdef: a list kept by a store of the things that someone wants as gifts
